Breadth-First.Explanation: Divergent exploration of multiple clues and hypotheses (wooden poles, sign “Bissener,” possible Berlin vs Munich) to narrow down neighborhood

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying specific hypothesis that the neighborhood is Hasenbergl in Munich by collecting detailed evidence
Depth-First.KeyElement: German license plate and street design clues supporting Hasenbergl, Munich

Depth-First.Explanation: Focused analysis of local signage and pavement details to confirm Munich over other cities
Depth-First.KeyElement: Blue van “Sanitär Heizung” and Munich-style kerb and paving slabs

Depth-First.Explanation: Convergent verification of Lochhauser Straße hypothesis through comparison of Berlin vs Munich road features
Depth-First.KeyElement: Tree-lined median and cycle path characteristic of Munich’s Lochhauser Straße

Depth-First.Explanation: Summarizing and finalizing the verified location hypothesis
Depth-First.KeyElement: Final conclusion: Hasenbergl, Feldmoching-Hasenbergl, Munich, Germany

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After detailed depth-first verification of Munich, shifts to broader exploration to consider alternative clues and hypotheses
After divergent clue exploration, converges on verifying a specific hypothesis (Lochhauser Straße) with detailed comparison
